text:
Disappointed with the smoked beer battered fish. Saw the pic in one of the reviews, looked good with 2 pieces of fish. Turned out to be only 1 piece with soggy batter, not crispy at all. I only tasted smoke and nothing else. Fish and batter were so bland, I had to add salt for taste apart from the tartar sauce.

The grilled chicken my hubby had tasted way better. Well seasoned to the right saltiness. Thumbs up for that.
Service staff are friendly.

Smokey’s is an awesome chill spot to get some delicious food and good beer. Their beef brisket reminds me of home in the US and the IPA beer list is top notch. I love the patio area and it feels so chill here. Happy I found this place

Decided I needed comfort food and this BBQ joint has been on my list for a while, so I hauled myself over to @smokeysbbq.sg in Joo Chiat for what I hoped was going to deliver some awesome home cooking. Man, did it ever!!!

We started with the chili cheese tater tots because duh, tots+cheese+chili = amazing. Crispy tots were finished off with cheese, chili, jalapeños, and sour cream and we all tucked in and loved them. Next stop was the BBQ combo - baby back ribs, brisket, pulled pork, pulled chicken with sides of coleslaw and cornbread. All the meats were super juicy and fork tender, the meat fell off the bone on the ribs, and the brisket could be pulled with a pork. Kudos on the chicken as it was not dried out at all.  Definitely the crowd favorite was brisket. The original BBQ sauce was great, but I loved the kick from the ghost sauce, spicy and sweet. Cornbread was equally yummy, and the coleslaw was so good we ordered a second serving.

For dessert we had the chocolate brownie with vanilla ice cream. While it was very tasty, I’d call this more cake than brownie, but it didn’t stop us from finishing it all off. Great beer selection, and since it was St. Patrick’s Day we had green beer which definitely reminded me of home.

All in all an awesome experience with great service and a very authentic BBQ vibe. Highly recommend

Pretty chill and nice place to enjoy the company of friends! Glad that it wasn’t too noisy or crowded!
Got to try lots of variations of meat because of their combo set offer where you can order different selections with sides! Really liked the tater tots too!
The owner was very nice, I mentioned in my booking that it was a bachelors night and they gave us a round of shots on the house!

Had baby back ribs and beef brisket combo. Meat is tender and falls off easily but felt that the bbq sauce is too overwhelming. Sweet potato fries not crispy enough and coleslaw pretty average. The brewlander porter not that great I feel, give me my Guinness!
